content:
Fuzhou has been focusing on developing several high-tech industries to upgrade its industrial structure and improve its economy. Here are some examples of the industries that Fuzhou has been emphasizing:

1. Integrated circuits (ICs): Fuzhou is positioning itself as a hub for IC production, design, and testing, to compete with other Chinese cities like Shanghai, Beijing, and Shenzhen. Fuzhou has invested heavily in building research and development centers for ICs, as well as production facilities.

2. New materials: Fuzhou is also focusing on developing new materials such as graphene, advanced ceramics, and high-performance metals. The city has attracted some of China's top material science talent and has built advanced research infrastructure for new materials.

3. Biomedicine: Fuzhou has established several biomedical science parks and has attracted many well-known domestic and foreign companies to invest in biopharmaceutical R&D, manufacturing, and sales. Fuzhou is creating a complete industrial chain for biomedicine, from developing new drugs to producing equipment and selling finished products.

4. Big data and artificial intelligence: Fuzhou is promoting big data and artificial intelligence as key drivers of its high-tech industry growth. The city has built data centers, provided subsidies for AI startups, and created partnerships with universities and research institutes to support research and development. 

5. New energy: Fuzhou is investing in the development of clean energy technologies including wind and solar energy. According to government statistics, by the end of 2019, the total installed capacity of wind and solar energy in Fuzhou reached 6.76 million kilowatts, making it one of the leading cities in China for clean energy. 

These high-tech industries are just a few examples. The government sees the development of the high-tech industry as a top priority for the future of Fuzhou's economy, and has invested in promoting the development of a robust ecosystem for high-tech business.
